author: robbedoya9
title: Assembly of State Blockchain PAC's
description: Charles Hoskinson requested the education and on-boarding of Politicians to ensure the continuation of the Cardano Eco-System.

f6_assessments.q0:
"The proposal is intended to require the education and boarding of Politicians to ensure the continuation of the Cardano Ecosystem. The idea for this proposal aligns with the challenge in Fund 8.

Charles Hoskinson is a Politician, with 6 years of experience in this field, and has held important positions. He currently keeps a list of groups of people who wish to be educated. These objects will help ensure the bright future of cryptocurrency in the future.

The proponent mentioned the solution he is holding that will solve the problems of the challenge. However, not all problems are resolved immediately. This section will be more clear if the proponent specifically offers what the solution to this challenge is.

The possible risks are that fans hate the Blockchain platform, which leads them to hate blockchain technology people. And fortunately, recently Executive Orders can protect against scams and protect the rights and safety of users on this platform. From this, the risks are solvable"
f6_assessments.q1:
"The proponent has not given a specific timeline and specific plan. It will be clearer if You include a complete list of participating events and specific periods that You attend in the next few months.

The required budget for this project is $5000. Based on the content of this proposal I have not seen a breakdown of this specific use of the budget. In addition, some points need to be clarified in detail. It will be more specific if you explain the estimated budget for each item. That helps this category have enough information to evaluate the project... In this proposal, there is no mention of human resources. Identity is also difficult to determine. It will be more convincing if you provide your identity on social networking sites or attachments"
f6_assessments.q2:
"At the moment it is difficult to determine the amount of measurement because there is no specific number. It will be confirmed after the project goes live, and the proponent will be contacted afterward. Hope You will provide the number of additional people later

The success of this project is defined as a great follow-up, will build something of their own through Cardano and the value the project brings to the future.

This is a new project."

f6_assessments.q0: Despite the surprisingly low amount of funds requests (and therefore low-risk of poorly allocated funds), I have zero confidence in the reliability of this proposal. This is simply based on the lack of detailed information provided. The proposal does not actually outline any concrete goals to be accomplished or impacts to be made. It vaguely identifies some complaints about the state of cryptocurrency and politics but does not state any specific actions to address those concerns. The proposal doesn't even identify what region is being served, which can only be deduced to the United States based on the use because of the mention of PACs. I would like to see a LinkedIn profile, but the proposal doesn't even actually mention his own name (except for the "listed by" line). As interested as I am in the type of work that could be done here and the minimal amount being requested, I cannot vote in favor if this proposal based on the information not provided.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no concrete roadmap and timeline, while the budget is not outlined at all. The plan section suggests an intention to attend various events where he can get in front of these unidentified political figures to encourage further education. This is not a reliable plan that we can vote favorably for because he identifies no specific events he will be attending and the amount of events he would be able to travel to is very minimal on a $5000 budget. He also doesn't have any concrete resources for sources of education to refer these figures to, except for a vague mention of something IOHK might be able to do. I need more planning, more details, and a lot of specifics.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no development for objective evaluative criteria to measure success. The only measurable metric identified is the number of contacts accumulated at these events, which guarantees no assurance of real-world impact. I believe the entire point of establishing metrics is to provide a mechanism for understanding progress and a potential need for correction. I don't get that here.

f6_assessments.q0: This is not a full-fledged proposal, only some disparate notes. There is no plan that could be assessed, no proper budget, no deliverables, no measures, nothing.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposer has just listed some thoughts but has not provided any concrete plan that could be evaluated. Nor are they willing to show their professional profile (even after asked for in the comments section).
f6_assessments.q2: There is nothing that could be tracked or evaluated. Next time, if you are serious about writing a proposal, you need to take a look at the proposer guidelines and attend a Catalyst School event or otherwise make sure that you are presenting a concrete plan.

f6_assessments.q0: Although the idea behind this proposal is a good one, the way they plan to implement the proposal is very vague and not sure how they will accomplish it.  More details is needed on how the work will make an impact.
f6_assessments.q1: There is little description on how this proposal will be possible and/or what they are planning to do leaving a lot of question marks on how this will be worked.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer is using a subjective measurement of success, which is not a good auditable metric to understand the progress of the project and/or take an objectively look at how it 's being developed and/or its impact.

f6_assessments.q0:
There is not a target problem to be addressed with this proposal, I would recommend that the proposer define a target problem so that the proposal can be better evaluated and understood.

Although the proposal describes its purpose, it is still a draft. Educating politicians about blockchain is within the scope of the challenge, but there is no plan/metrics or KPIs that allow assessing the potential for impact.

I recommend that the proposer check the documentation for creating proposals in the IdeaScale FAQ section.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is not enough information to assess the proposer's qualifications, there is only the mention that he is operations campaign strategist to a primary elected candidate, but there is no information about his knowledge of blockchain technology, which is essential considering that the objective is to educate politicians about blockchain. There are no sources to check the proposer's qualifications.

There is no plan, the proposal is more of an idea. There is no budget breakdown, only mentions that the budget would be used for travel, accommodation and food expenses related to commercial travel related to the proposal.

I recommend that the proposer read the proposal writing guide in the IdeaScale FAQ section to write a more structured proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no clarity on the problem to be solved. There is no clarity in the solution, the plan needs more details. There are no roadmap, metrics, or KPIs, so I strongly disagree that this proposal is properly auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: For a complete by in or acceptance of a new technology we need to involve politicians. Hence, for the Cardano Blockchain ecosystem to reach far this proposal is worth it.
f6_assessments.q1: With the proposers’ background in politics and lobbying the feasibility of this proposal seems fine. But not much is address on the risk that was detailed in the proposers which seems there is no idea of solving that.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability of this seems very minimum from the write up and the activities to be undertaken is not really spelt out, it looks like the prosper is not really prepared for this

solution: Individual outreach to a 1 on 1 person is actually me suiting up and showing up with familiarity of people at the events that get me results
experience: I have about 6 years experience working within Politicians, taken on special long term tasks by politicians and was a operations campaign strategist to a primary elected candidate.   I have a current list of people looking to be educated that can expand easily with my efforts.
